thread.title: Tech Center announces April Student of the Month
thread.title_full: Tech Center announces April Student of the Month

author: ohtadmin
title: Tech Center announces April Student of the Month
text:
The Huron Area Technical Center recently announced the Student of the Month recipient for April. Students are selected based on a variety of criteria including: achievement in career technical education, outstanding attendance, enrollment status, CTE-related extracurricular activities, on-the-job training placements, work experience, and future CTE Program-related education and/or employment plans.
Miley Donnellon is the Huron Technical Center Student of the Month for April. She is a senior at Ubly Community Schools and is a second-year student in the Huron Area Technical Center’s Health Science Program. Miley is the daughter of Thomas and Melissa Donnellon.
Miley has earned certifications in Basic Life Support, First Aid, and Stop the Bleed. She has also successfully completed the Certified Nurse Aide (CNA) program and is now a certified CNA. Currently, she is gaining valuable hands-on experience through an on-the-job training position at a local healthcare facility, where she continues to show professionalism and a strong work ethic.
In addition to her academic and clinical accomplishments, Miley is an active member of Health Occupations Students of America (HOSA) and the National Technical Honor Society (NTHS). Her involvement in these organizations reflects her commitment to leadership and excellence in the healthcare field.
Her future plans include attending the University of Michigan to major in nursing.
Miley will receive a certificate of award and will be honored during a luncheon at the Main Street Café, located inside the Huron Area Technical Center.
